definition: to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward

sentences.english: When Natalie finds out he is a detective she tells him to stay away from her family.
sentences.chinese: 当纳塔莉发现他是一名侦探，她告诉他远离她的家庭。

sentences.english: She hired a detective to shadow her husband.
sentences.chinese: 她雇了私家侦探盯梢她丈夫。

sentences.english: She raked out a detective story and lent it to her friend.
sentences.chinese: 她翻出一本侦探小说借给了她的朋友。

sentences.english: That new detective show has been getting good reviews.
sentences.chinese: 那部新放映的侦探片受到了好评。

sentences.english: I'm sure he'll be telling Detective Modine what he was doing.
sentences.chinese: 我保证他会告诉摩丁侦探他在干什么。

sentences.english: Untangling finances feels like playing detective to me.
sentences.chinese: 对我来说，解开财务问题感觉就是做一个侦探。

sentences.english: In the Unite States, Bloodhounds help find missing people.
sentences.chinese: 在美国，侦探犬有助于搜索失踪者。

sentences.english: His five-year-old son thinks he’s a private eye who catches bad guys.
sentences.chinese: 他五岁的儿子以为他是个专门惩治坏人的私家侦探。

sentences.english: The detective took out after a burglar.
The detectives swore out a search warrant.
sentences.chinese: 侦探宣誓所控属实后领到一张搜查证。
侦探长的眼珠子都凸出来了。

sentences.english: I like to read detective stories.
The detective is completely correct in his surmises.
sentences.chinese: 这个侦探所推测的完全正确。

sentences.english: The detective belted his pistol on.
sentences.chinese: 侦探用带子将手枪系住。

sentences.english: What, then, does detective fiction say about her?
sentences.chinese: 那么，像侦探小说一样，我们又如何分析她呢？

definition: Sherlock Holmes, 歇洛克·福爾摩斯|歇洛克·福尔摩斯[Xie1 luo4 ke4 · Fu2 er3 mo2 si1]
master sleuth/lit. miraculous detective/cf Sherlock Holmes 福爾摩斯|福尔摩斯[Fu2 er3 mo2 si1] or Di Renjie 狄仁傑|狄仁杰[Di2 Ren2 jie2]
secret service/special service/secret service agent/special agent
abbr. for 刑事警察[xing2 shi4 jing3 cha2]/criminal police
to hide (as an undercover agent)/an insider (in a gang of thieves)/a mole
to solve a case/shabby old table
